top.title: 'No help, no food, no water': hurricane-hit Jamaican towns desperately wait for aid
top.summary: Days after Hurricane Melissa hit, communities are isolated with little food, no water, and no idea of when normalcy will return.

top.title: Hurricane Melissa death toll rises to 28 in Jamaica
top.summary: PM Andrew Holness warns of reports of possible fatalities still to be verified - suggesting the figure may yet rise.

top.title: Louvre heist carried out by petty criminals, prosecutor says
top.summary: The Paris prosecutor says four suspects arrested so far are "clearly local people", not organised crime professionals.

top.title: Pornhub says UK visitors down 77% since age checks came in
top.summary: The site tells BBC News it believes people are viewing riskier sites - but they may just be using VPNs.

top.title: Security concerns over system at heart of digital ID
top.summary: The government is facing questions over whether One Login can be trusted to keep people's personal data secure.

top.title: Watchdog slams O2 over unexpected price rise
top.summary: The media regulator said it was disappointed O2 raised prices more than was advertised when customers took out contracts.

title.#text: You need to watch the found footage classic, Lake Mungo
Why the Zune never killed the iPod
The perfect grocery list-making app doesn’t exist
